de.hsos.ecs.richwps.wpsmonitor.communication.wpsclient.defaultimpl

Class SimpleWpsClient

  • java.lang.Object
    • de.hsos.ecs.richwps.wpsmonitor.communication.wpsclient.defaultimpl.SimpleWpsClient
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    WpsClient

    public class SimpleWpsClient
extends Object
implements WpsClient
    A very simple WpsClient Implementation based on Apache HTTP Components Lib. This WPS Client is developed to send a raw request over http-post method to a wps server. After the request is executed, the client awaits a response. This simple wps client can check the response for WPS-Errors. If the WpsResponse is not a valid XML String, the client will interprete this as connection error, because the wps server seems to be unreachable (or no wps server runs at this server).
    Author:
    Florian Vogelpohl
    See Also:
    WpsClient, WpsResponse, WpsRequest

      • execute

        public WpsResponse execute(WpsRequest wpsRequest)
        Description copied from interface: WpsClient
        Invoke the WpsClient to execute the given wpsRequest. The WpsClient should call WpsRequest.prepareRequest() at real execution Time. WpsRequest.prepareRequest() sets the now-time as a new Date() Object. e.g. 
             public void execute(final WpsRequest request) {
          // prepare client
          // do some stuff
          request.prepareRequest();
          HttpResponse response = specificCode.executeRequest(niceThingsToDo);
          WpsResponse response = new WpsResponse ..
     }
        The return value WpsResponse should also contain the accurate response-Time. Accurate response-time means the response time of the Server and not the time after the WpsClient has succesfully processed the execute-Method.
        Specified by:
        execute in interface WpsClient
        Parameters:
        wpsRequest - WpsRequest instance that contains all necessary informations to call a server
        Returns:
        The Answer from the called server
